page.title: 01THE AREA
page.content: The main feature of the area is agriculture as most of the land is set out in farms on the north facing slope of the valley of the River Wear.The most important feature of the farms is grazing of sheep and cattle and the production of the grass crops hay and silage for winter feed.A small amount of grain is also grown. About half of the village of Toft Hill is included.The houses are mainly built of stone and arranged in terraces in ribbon development beside the main A68 road to Scotland. Witton Castle built in 1410 A.D. has its estate in the area.50% is used for agriculture;30% for forestry and 20% for leisure.There is a caravan and camping site including all the necessary facilities.
